meanings.definition: To make or become French in language, customs, etc.
meanings.sent1: She is gallicizing her wardrobe by adding berets and striped shirts.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant started gallicizing their menu by adding escargot and coq au vin.
meanings.sent3: The dog was gallicizing itself by barking with a French accent.
meanings.sent4: The garden was gallicizing under the influence of French landscaping trends.
meanings.sent5: The town was slowly gallicizing, with more people speaking French and enjoying croissants.

meanings.definition: To adapt or conform to French style or influence.
meanings.sent1: He is gallicizing his writing by using French phrases and expressions.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer was gallicizing her collection with Parisian-inspired designs.
meanings.sent3: The car seemed to be gallicizing itself with a new French paint job.
meanings.sent4: The music was gallicizing the crowd, transporting them to a Parisian cafe.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition was gallicizing visitors with its display of French impressionist paintings.
